title: Solid-State Diffusion: An Introduction
authors: Jairo Rond\'on, Angel Gonzalez-Lizardo, Ricardo Bravo, and Juan Valera
abstract:
This research explores an introduction to solid-state diffusion, focusing on
its importance in materials engineering. It examines vacancy and interstitial
diffusion mechanisms, the application of Fick's laws, and their impact on
processes such as phase precipitation and recrystallization in metals and
alloys. Additionally, it addresses its relevance in grain growth, diffusion
welding, and sintering, which are critical processes to improve the properties
of materials with engineering applications in various areas such as biomedical,
electrical, and chemistry.
